bird_report.population_trend_additional_info:
The annual breeding time monitoring data of the Finnish Museum of Natural History is too small for reliable analysis.
BirdLife Finland's regional observation summary database of Finnish Birdwatching societies on scarce bird species gives increase of 125-200 % for short term trend (2000-2011).

bird_report.population_trend_additional_info:
The Pygmy Owl data gathered by Raptor Grid is relevant from 1994 onwards only, therefore the long term trend can't be calculated. The number of the occupied territories of the Pygmy Owl varies from year to year, following the phases of the vole population cycle. The population size is not known until 1990's, but since 1995 the population has remained stable despite the strong fluctuation between the years.
Saurola, P. 2008. Monitoring birds of prey in Finland: a summary of methods, trends, and statistical power. Ambio 37: 413-419.

bird_report.population_trend_additional_info: Slopes with SE were estimated based on models (1) with changepoint set only at 1986 and (2) with changepoints set at 1986 and 2001. Minimum and maximum percentage change i.e. upper and lower 95% c.i. are given for long (1) and short-term (2) trends. TRIM software was used in the estimation of slopes and SEs [Pannekoek, J., & Van Strien, A. J. (2005). Trim 3 manual (Trends and indices for monitoring data). Voorburg, Netherlands: Statistics Netherlands.]

bird_report.population_trend_additional_info: The small Finnish Yellow-breasted Bunting population is on the edge of its range. The main population in Russia, at least in northwestern parts of the country, has been decreasing in recent years and probably its range has decreased. This would have been impacts to the Finnish population, too.

bird_report.measures_taken: Several schemes of the national agri-environment plan have favoured the Quail: - demand of 30 or 50 % of vegetation cover over winter (stubble or light tillage) - reduction in herbicide use - environmental fallowing - support for organic farming
bird_report.further_information:
The species distribution is too sporadic and occurrence unpredictable that a specific national MP would be reasonable.
About threats: Lennon, R. J., Dunn, J. C., Stockdale, J. E. , Goodman, S. J. & Hamer, K. C. 2013: Trichomonad parasite infection in four species of Columbidae in the UK. Parasitology 140:1368--1376.

bird_report.population_additional_info:
According to more intensive studies (references in 2.6), the population size is likely to be considerably larger (not ready at hand) than revealed by line transect censuses (the current estimate).
Tiainen, J., Seimola, T., Rintala, J. & Holmström, H. 2012: Changes in farmland bird populations in Finland in 2001–2011. – Linnut-vuosikirja 2011: 38–47. (in Finnish with English summary)
Tiainen, J., Seimola, T., Holmström, H. & Rintala, J. 2012: Farmland bird populations in Åland in 2011 with a comparison to 2001 and continental Finland. – Linnut-vuosikirja 2011: 48–57. (in Finnish with English summary)
Tiainen, J. & Seimola, T. 2010: Density of breeding farmland birds in large south Finnish agricultural areas. – Linnut-vuosikirja 2009: 146–151. (in Finnish with English summary)

bird_report.population_trend_additional_info: The two monitoring scheme result in controversial results. Here the trends are adopted from the more intensive farmland scheme. The monitoring data of the Finnish Museum of Natural History gives decrease of 10-37 % for short term (2001-2012) and decrease of 20-38 % for long term (1980-2012) trend.

bird_report.population_additional_info:
Population size on the basis of bird monitoring schemes of the Finnish Museum of Natural History would be 1900-9800.
Annual population size variations strong.

population_trend_method.desc: Estimate based on partial data with some extrapolation and/or modelling

bird_report.population_trend_sources:
BirdLife Finland 2013: Regional observation summary database of Finnish birdwatching societies on scarce birds.
Tiainen, J., Seimola, T., Rintala, J. & Holmström, H. 2012: Changes in farmland bird populations in Finland in 2001–2011. – Linnut-vuosikirja 2011: 38–47. (in Finnish with English summary)

population_trend_long_method.desc: Estimate based on partial data with some extrapolation and/or modelling

bird_report.population_trend_long_sources: BirdLife Finland 2013: Regional observation summary database of Finnish birdwatching societies on scarce birds.
bird_report.population_trend_additional_info: From the data, a short-term trend mean estimated at –37% (mean) with a minimum of –74% and maximum of +46% (Museum of Natural History census-based data). The trend was rather similar in annual monitoring of farmland plots and in the observation record data of BirdLife. It has been typical for the Corncrake that it has occasional years of extreme abundance. During the short-term reporting period such years were 2002 and 2007. Extreme peak years make it difficult to estimate a short-term trend reliably.

range_method.desc: Complete survey or a statistically robust estimate

bird_report.measures_taken: Some schemes of the national agri-environment plan have favoured the Corncrake: - environmental fallowing; cutting not allowed before 1 August - support for organic farming
